result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Long #337833 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerome Long #337833 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerome Long #337833 was found guilty of Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONSECUTIVE TO ANY SENTENCE SERVING. 
COUNT ONE DISMISSED.

superMiscConds.notes: Continue with psychological treatment and anger management treatment as determined by probation agent.

reply letter re: amending JOC
Letter from Records Assistant @ Columbia Correctional Institution requesting a Court review of the JOC dtd 3-20-15

Defendant Jerome Long  #337833 in court, in custody with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count two.   Court sentenced defendant to 3 1/2 years prison, consisting of 1 year confinement and 2 1/2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any sentence serving. Conditions: $518 costs, continue with psychological treatment and anger management treatment. as determined by probation agent. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Academy, is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. No Jail credit. Ct. 1 dismissed.
